full_addr.title: Full address
full_addr.description: Query contains a full street address including house/building number, street name, city and often state/zip. Example: '133 Spring Hill Ave Bowling Green'.

street.title: Street / partial address
street.description: Query contains only a street name or an incomplete address without a specific house or building number. Example: 'Cedar Street'.

poi_name.title: Specific POI name
poi_name.description: Query names a particular business, landmark or point of interest. Example: 'Menlo Park Mall' or 'The Metropolitan Museum on Fifth Avenue'.

chain_plain.title: Chain brand (no location modifier)
chain_plain.description: Query asks for a chain business without a location modifier. Example: 'Starbucks', 'Applebee’s'.

chain_city.title: Chain + general location modifier
chain_city.description: Query asks for a chain business with an explicit general location (city/area). Example: 'Wegmans Rockville MD'. Per guidelines 10.6.3.1 this implies a general location and not the user/viewport.

locality.title: Locality (city/region)
locality.description: Query asks for a city or region. Example: 'Orlando'.

transit.title: Transit station or stop
transit.description: Query names a transit station or stop. Example: 'Fremont Station', '16th Street Mission Station'.

category_mall.title: Mall category
category_mall.description: Query asks for a mall (shopping center), not a specific store. Example: 'mall'.

category.title: Other category
category.description: Generic category queries such as 'hotel', 'coffee shop', etc., that are not chain- or mall-specific.

other.title: Other / unknown
other.description: Catch-all for queries that don’t fit the specific query types above.

address_only.title: Address only
address_only.description: Result provides only a formatted address (title and details) with no business or POI name.

street.title: Street
street.description: Result is a street or thoroughfare, not a specific address or business.

poi.title: Point of interest
poi.description: Result is a full POI (business/landmark) including its name and address.

dept.title: Department or service
dept.description: Result is a department, service, or sub-unit within a larger business/chain. Example: 'Sam’s Club Pharmacy' or 'Target Optical'.

store_in_mall.title: Store inside mall
store_in_mall.description: Result is a store or business located inside a mall. Used when evaluating mall queries (lack of connection when query asks for a mall but result is a store).

mall.title: Mall / shopping center
mall.description: Result is a shopping mall or retail complex.

station.title: Transit station
station.description: Result is a transit station or stop (rail, metro, bus).

airport.title: Airport
airport.description: Result is an airport. Often appears as an unexpected result for city/locality queries as a secondary transit intent.

locality.title: Locality
locality.description: Result is a city or region.

other.title: Other / unknown
other.description: Result type does not fit specific categories above.

fresh.description: The map has been recently interacted with; use the viewport as the location intent if the user is outside.

stale.description: The map hasn’t been used recently; default to the user’s location as the intent.

none.description: No viewport data provided; treat as fresh by default.

in.description: The user is located inside the fresh viewport.

out.description: The user is outside the fresh viewport.

single_building.title: Single Building / Residential
single_building.description: Standalone house or business. Perfect = rooftop/front feature; Approximate = same parcel (yard/driveway/parking/auxiliary building like garage/shed).

shared_roof_stripmall.title: Shared Rooftop / Strip Mall
shared_roof_stripmall.description: Multiple businesses under one connected roof. With good evidence (Street View / mall directory), Perfect = exact unit portion; Approximate = other roof portions or shared parking. Next Door is not used for shared parcels.

transit.title: Transit POI
transit.description: Stations/stops. Perfect = platform/building/waiting area; Approximate = within ~50m / station parcel/parking. Next Door is not allowed for transit.

area_polygon.title: Administrative Area / Park
area_polygon.description: City/neighborhood/park polygon. Perfect = pin tip inside boundary. Wrong = outside boundary. Approximate/Next Door are not used.

on_feature.title: On Feature (Perfect)
on_feature.description: Pin tip lands directly on the correct feature: rooftop/unit area, transit waiting area/platform, or inside the area polygon.

on_property.title: On Property (Approximate)
on_property.description: Pin tip is within correct property/parcel boundaries but not on the perfect feature area (e.g., parking lot, driveway, yard, auxiliary building like garage/shed).

next_door.title: Next Door
next_door.description: Immediately adjacent property on the same block/side; must NOT be separated by a cross-street/public road. Not used for transit, polygons, or shared-roof/strip-mall parcels.

wrong.title: Wrong
wrong.description: Outside the correct property/feature and outside valid Next Door. Includes being across a cross-street (different block).

exact.description: Name matches official real-world name (including branding).

partial.description: Close match but missing/extra elements (e.g., branch descriptor, suite/wing) or minor differences.

no.description: Does not match the real-world name.

exact.description: Address components match the real-world address.

formatting_only.description: All components present; differences are formatting only (punctuation/order/spacing).

no.description: Address is incorrect or missing required components.

closest.description: The result is the nearest real-world location for a chain query in the location intent area.

second.description: There is one closer real-world location of the same chain; user may accept this but it merits demotion.

third.description: There are two closer real-world locations; this option is still within range but less relevant.

irrelevant.description: The result is far beyond the reasonable search area given the density of real-world options.

0.description: There are no open/existing branches inside the explicitly requested location.

1.description: There is exactly one open/existing branch of the chain inside the explicitly requested location.

2+.description: There are two or more open/existing branches of the chain inside the explicitly requested location.

adjacent.description: Result is immediately adjacent or very close to the requested location.

near.description: Result is near but not adjacent to the requested location.

far.description: Result is far from the requested location; likely irrelevant if closer options exist inside.
